prompt: I'm building an MCP server for a project management tool and I'm not sure whether to use streamable HTTP or stdio transport. What are the trade-offs?
baseline_response:
When choosing between Streamable HTTP and stdio transport for an MCP (Message Control Protocol) server, there are several factors to consider:

Streamable HTTP Transport:
Pros:
- Works well through firewalls
- Supports web-based communication
- Easier to implement in web environments
- Stateless by default
- Can leverage existing HTTP infrastructure

Cons:
- Higher overhead
- Potential latency issues
- More complex authentication
- Requires more bandwidth

stdio Transport:
Pros:
- Lower latency
- Less overhead
- Direct local or network communication
- Simpler implementation
- More lightweight

Cons:
- Firewall limitations
- Less flexible for web-based scenarios
- Requires direct connection
- Limited scalability

Recommendation:
Choose based on your specific use case:
- Web-based tool ‚Üí Streamable HTTP
- Local/controlled network ‚Üí stdio
- Hybrid/flexibility ‚Üí Consider supporting both

Example architecture consideration:
```javascript
// HTTP transport
function httpTransport(config) {
  return {
    connect: (endpoint) => { /* HTTP connection logic */ },
    send: (message) => { /* HTTP post */ },
    receive: (callback) => { /* HTTP polling/websocket */ }
  };
}

// stdio transport
function stdioTransport(config) {
  return {
    connect: () => { /* Direct stdio connection */ },
    send: (message) => { /* Direct write */ },
    receive: (callback) => { /* Direct read */ }
  };
}
```
